intro: Capsella grossa, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has heart-shaped, hairy leaves. Its small, white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom from spring to early summer. Capsella grossa is often found in disturbed soils and can be a common weed in agricultural fields.
